order

Class OrderListJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • order.OrderListJDBC

  • public class OrderListJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
    OrderListJDBC Used for implementing the database connection to order list. It will connect to RAS database. The OrderListJDBC class will be a mirror class of the OrderList class.
    Author:
    benjaminxerri

      Constructor for OrderList JDBC The connection is created here

    • Method Detail

      • placeOrder

        public boolean placeOrder(Order o,
                          OrderItems... args)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        JDBC method that handles the database logic of placing the order. It inserts the order into the 'Orders' table, Then it inserts any number of Order Items.
        Parameters:
        o - The order that will be added to the database.
        Returns:
        true of the order was placed, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateOrder

        public boolean updateOrder(int orderID,
                           Order orderToChange)
        Handles Database logic to update an existing order, already in the order list
        Parameters:
        orderID,orderToChange - Takes in an order that will be updated, and the new order that will replace it
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true for a successful update, false if the order was not updated.

      • payOrder

        public Order payOrder(int orderId)
        Takes in order id to pay that specific order. communicated with order Entity to change the status of an order. Method communicates with table entity to clear a table if the order status was successfully changed.
        Parameters:
        orderId - Takes in the order ID
        Returns:
        Order Returns the newly updated order with a changed order status, or null if the order could not be updated.

      • deleteOrder

        public Order deleteOrder(int orderID)
        Handles Database logic to remove an order from the order table in the database.
        Parameters:
        orderID - The order id
        Returns:
        Order Returns the order object if it was deleted, or null if the order was not found.

      • searchOrder

        public Order searchOrder(int orderId)
        Handles Database logic to search if an order exists.
        Parameters:
        orderId - Search by order Id.
        Returns:
        Returns the order that was found, or null of the order was not found.
